Package graphpack

common GraphPack classes
the most important classes are GraphPackService, which manages a GraphPack service and GraphPackClient, which represents a client that can connect to GraphPack services

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Edge.Payload contains data that is associated with an edge
IClient a generic reference to a client - it can be either local or remote
INode a generic reference to a node - it can be either local or remote
INodeLocator locates an INode
IService a generic reference to a service - it can be either local or remote
 

Class Summary
ClientLocation Uniquely identifies an IClient
CommonNodeLocator generic implementation of INodeLocator.
Edge edge with an interactable reference to its target node
Edge.Payload.EmptyPayload a payload that without any fields
Edge.Payload.SerializedEmptyPayload a serialized version of Edge.Payload.EmptyPayload
GraphPackClient An abstraction of a GraphPack client (bridge design pattern)
used in order to contact GraphPack services remotely
GraphPackService An abstraction of a GraphPack service (bridge design pattern)
NodeLocation Uniquely identifies an INode
RmiGraphPackClient a concrete GraphPackClient that is implemented using:
connection = ConnectionManager
RmiInmemoryQuartzGraphPackService a concrete GraphPackService that is implemented using:
persistence = ClientStore, NodeStore, EdgeStore
connection = ConnectionManager
task management = TaskManager
SerializableEdge a representation of an edge that can be directly serialized (it doesn't contain external references)
 

Package graphpack Description

common GraphPack classes
the most important classes are GraphPackService, which manages a GraphPack service and GraphPackClient, which represents a client that can connect to GraphPack services
